perturbation.original_text:
Pursuant to and in accordance with Section 5-1401 of the New York General Obligations Law, the Parties hereto agree that this Amendment in
all respects, and any claim or cause of action based upon or arising out of this Amendment, or any dealing between the Parties relating to the
subject matter of this Amendment or the transactions contemplated hereby or the Company/Repairer relationship being established, shall be
governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York, U.S.A. as applied to contracts to be performed wholly
within the State of New York (Exclusive of Section 7-101 of the New York General Obligations Law which is inapplicable to this Amendment).
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties hereto agree that this Amendment in all respects, and any claim or cause of action based upon or arising out of this Amendment, or any dealing between the Parties relating to the subject matter of this Amendment or the transactions contemplated hereby or the Company/Repairer relationship being established, shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with the principles of international commercial law.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to New York law and replacing it with 'principles of international commercial law,' the contract creates ambiguity about the governing legal standards. This omission could deprive the consumer (Azul) of specific protections afforded under New York law, such as implied warranties or specific remedies for breach of contract, leading to a legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Obligations Law, Section 5-1401

perturbation.original_text:
in the event of a dispute arising out of or relating to this Amendment, including without limitation disputes regarding the
existence, validity or termination of this Amendment (a “Dispute”), either Party may notify such Dispute to the other through service of a
written notice (the “Notice of Dispute”). The Parties shall make their reasonable endeavours to settle the Dispute amicably by a committee
composed of one (1) management representative of each Party (the “Representatives”). Such committee shall be created by the Parties within
[*****] from the date of receipt of the Notice of Dispute.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event of a dispute arising out of or relating to this Amendment, either Party may notify such Dispute to the other through service of a written notice. The Parties shall endeavor to settle the Dispute amicably.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the obligation to create a formal committee with management representatives within a defined timeframe weakens the dispute resolution process. This omission eliminates a structured step that could help facilitate early resolution, potentially forcing the consumer (Azul) into more costly and time-consuming arbitration proceedings prematurely. This contradicts the principle of good faith negotiation implied in many jurisdictions, including New York.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under New York law.

perturbation.original_text:
The arbitration, and any proceedings, and meetings incidental to or related to the arbitration process, shall take place in New York,
U.S.A, and the language to be used in the arbitral proceedings shall be English; arbitral award shall be final and binding upon the
Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: The arbitration shall take place at a location to be determined by the arbitration tribunal, and the language to be used in the arbitral proceedings shall be at the tribunal's discretion; arbitral award shall be final and binding upon the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the guarantee that arbitration will occur in New York and allowing the tribunal to decide on the location, and also giving the tribunal the decision on language, this introduces uncertainty and increased costs for Azul. New York provides a familiar legal environment for Azul, changing this to a location decided by the arbitration tribunal can add travel costs and unfamiliar jurisdiction. This impacts the business and thus is a legal risk for Azul
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Civil Practice Law and Rules concerning arbitration (though not directly violated, the change undermines the predictability and fairness expected under New York legal principles).
